hadithText: Abu Huraira said: "I have not seen anything more beautiful than Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace). The sun seemed to shine in his face. Nor have I seen anyone more rapid in his gait than Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace). The earth seemed to be folded up for him. We must strenuously exert ourselves, while he is not subject to any stress."
comments: That means we could only with effort keep up with his normal pace walking.

hadithText: Ibrahim ibn Muhammad, one of the offspring of 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, told me: “When "Ali described the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), he said: ‘When he walked, he moved as if he were descending a declivity'.”
comments: This has been discussed in the chapter on the 'Noble features Sayyidina Rasulullah Sallallahu 'Alayhi Wasallam.

hadithText: Ali ibn Abi Talib said (may Allah ennoble his countenance): "When the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) walked, he inclined forward as if he were descending a declivity.”
